intro: Tabernaemontana sessilis, commonly known as the sessile angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has smooth, often hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces蓇葖 fruits that contain seeds with silky hairs, aiding in their dispersal.
